2. Data Import

Now that you’ve created your Atlas database, import the sample dataset using the mongorestore commandline utility:

  1. Get the sample data
    1. Get the code from https://github.com/WildAid/o-fish-realm
      git clone https://github.com/WildAid/o-fish-realm.git

      For now, download and extract CodeForGoodDataSet.tar.gz.

    2. Go into the o-fish-realm directory:
      cd o-fish-realm

    3. Note the path to the directory CodeForGoodbackup, which contains a directory called “wildaid”. Put it in the “Path to sample data” section of the template.

    4. Note the path to the directory WildAidDemo,and put it in the “Path to Realm code” section of the template.

  2. Get connection string
    1. Click CONNECT in the cluster itself (or as previously on the “all clusters” page for the project):

    2. Click on Connect using MongoDB Shell, then “I have the mongo shell installed “

    3. Copy the connection string

    4. Click “Close”

    5. Paste the connection string into the “Atlas Cluster connection string” in your template.

  3. In a terminal window, use the mongorestore utility to import the data you got in the first step. use the mongorestore utility and the “Path to sample data”, and the “Atlas Cluster connection string”. Modify the connection string - just after mongodb+srv:// you should put in the “Atlas Cluster Admin username” from the template, followed by @ and then the rest of the mongodb+srv link - so it looks something like this:
    • mongorestore --drop --uri "mongodb+srv://admin@oceanwatchdata-xxxxx.mongodb.net/test" /PATH/TO/CodeForGoodbackup
      When it is successful, you will see a message like:
      17542 document(s) restored successfully. 0 document(s) failed to restore.

  4. Verify with Data Explorer

    1. Go to Collections in the Atlas UI:

    2. Click on the BoardingReports collection and verify there are records:

Great work, now you’re ready to hook up Realm…
